articles.content: Declan would never have found out his therapist was using ChatGPT had it not been for a technical mishap. The connection was patchy during one of their online sessions, so Declan suggested they turn off their video feeds. Instead, his therapist began inadvertently sharing his screen. ‚ÄúSuddenly, I was watching him use ChatGPT,‚Äù says Declan, 31, who lives in Los Angeles. ‚ÄúHe was taking what I was saying and putting it into ChatGPT, and then summarizing or cherry-picking answers.‚Äù Declan was so sho
articles.author: Laurie Clarke

articles.content: JBL just announced a new portable Bluetooth speaker, called the Grip . This model includes a rope hook, which should make it easy to attach to backpacks, ski gear, or just about anything else. It also features customizable ambient lighting that actually looks pretty useful. The company says this lighting scheme makes the speaker a "perfect bedside companion for late-night reading." A speaker that doubles as a night light? I can see the use for that. As for the audio, JBL promises "pro sound" at

articles.content: It was a quiet Labor Day weekend for tech, but the Engadget team has kept busy testing out new gear from the likes of DJI, Sony and Bose. The wireless mics have a wholesale design change from the Mic 2, plus many improvements in sound quality, noise reduction and the number of subjects you can record at once ‚Äî though there is one downgrade compared to the last model.
